intro: Dasyloma laciniatum, commonly known as the laceleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely dissected, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and modest blooms.
